712336f-a.text:
18-12 East 36th Street, south side, between Madison and Fifth
Avenues.
About 1915.

721271f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, at and adjoining the S.E. corner of 3oth Street, ahowing a new apartment building, No. 22 East 36th Street, replacing old 213-215 Madison Avenue and 2o East 36th Street.
About 1927.

721269f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, north from 36th Street, showing the old residence on the S.E. corner of 37th Street and the National Democratic Club in the old Delmar Mansion on the N.E. corne . The block of small houses between 38th and 39th Streets will be
demolished in 1931.
June 6, 1929.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

712326f.text:
East 36th Street, north side, west from Park to Madison (left) Aves.. showing the Morgan Library (foreground) and its Annex at the N.E. corner of Madison Ave. The latter was formerly (prior to reconstruction in 1977) the Morgan residence, which now is at the S.E. corner of Madison Ave.,
and East 37th Street.
January 30, 1938.
George D. Chinn.

712331f-a.text:
J. P. Morgan Library and Art Gallery, 3oth Street, north side, adjoining and at the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue.
About 1930.
Ewing Galloway.

712337f.text:
36th Street, south side, west from No. 12 East, between Madison and Fifth Avenues, the side door of the lInternational Combustion
Buildins.
May 31, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

1558194.folder: East 36th Street - Madison Avenue, Manhattan, NY

1507621.title: Madison Avenue - 36th Street, northeast corner
1507621.folder: Madison Avenue - 36th Street, northeast corner, Manhattan, NY

721270f-a.text:
900 Madison Avenue, at S.W. corner of 36th Street, diagonally acroas from Morgan residence, in the old Astor block. It was erected
in 1926.  About 1928.
TRE NEV YORE
PUBLLC LIBRARY

721272f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, between E. 36th and E. 37th Streets, showing the garden separating the J. P. Morgan residence (left, not shown) and the Morgan Library annex (right). The latter is upon the site of the former Morgan Sr. home and is at the N.E. corner of 36th Street. To the
east of same appears the Library proper.
June 6, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

721273f-a.text:
Madison Ave., west side, south from East 37th to 36th Streets. To the left appears a portion of the Combustion Engineering Building occupying the avenue frontage
from 36th to 35th Streets.
The N. Y. Times reports the proposed erection of a 14 story apartment house replacing No's. 220-30 Madison Ave. and 16-18 E. 37th Street. This is to cost $l,O50,000 under plans drawn by Kenneth B. Norton, architect. View No. 2 is limited and shows this site, the S. W. corner of East 37th Street. The J. P. Morgan house is to the left (not shown) and faces these buildings.
View 1: May 31, 1928
View 2: Decemmber 2, 1931
P. L. Sperr

721273f-b.text:
Madison Ave., west side, south from East 37th to 36th Streets. To the left appears a portion of the Combustion Engineering Building occupying the avenue frontage
from 36th to 35th Streets.
The N. Y. Times reports the proposed erection of a 14 story apartment house replacing No's. 220-30 Madison Ave. and 16-18 E. 37th Street. This is to cost $l,O50,000 under plans drawn by Kenneth B. Norton, architect. View No. 2 is limited and shows this site, the S. W. corner of East 37th Street. The J. P. Morgan house is to the left (not shown) and faces these buildings.
View 1: May 31, 1928
View 2: Decemmber 2, 1931
P. L. Sperr

721297f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, from 39th to 36th Streets, showing the Heckscher Building newly erected on the S.W. corner of 38th Street, and houses between 38th and 39th Streets, which still stand in 1935.

The Heckscher Building was erected on the site of the old Theodore A. Havemeyer residence (built abour 1870), which was bought by August Heckscher in 1915 and demolished in October of that year.  Erection of this 16-story building was unsuccessfully contested in court by J.P. Morgan and other Murray Hill residents.

1916 or early 1917.
